allowance(address,address).code: function allowance(address owner, address spender) external view returns (uint256)

approve(address,uint256).code: function approve(address spender, uint256 amount) external nonpayable returns (bool)
approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOf(address).code: function balanceOf(address account) external view returns (uint256)

bridge(string,string,uint256).code: function bridge(string destinationAddress, string receiverAddress, uint256 amount) external payable

destinationAddress.description: The destination address on the other chain.

receiverAddress.description: The receiver address on the other chain.

amount.description: The amount of UMEE tokens to be bridged.

bridge(string,string,uint256).details: Bridges UMEE tokens from current chain to the Umee Cosmos Chain

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).code: function decreaseAllowance(address spender, uint256 subtractedValue) external nonpayable returns (bool)
decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

execute(bytes32,string,string,bytes).code: function execute(bytes32 commandId, string sourceChain, string sourceAddress, bytes payload) external nonpayable

executeWithToken(bytes32,string,string,b.code: function executeWithToken(bytes32 commandId, string sourceChain, string sourceAddress, bytes payload, string tokenSymbol, uint256 amount) external nonpayable

gasReceiver().code: function gasReceiver() external view returns (contract IAxelarGasService)

gateway().code: function gateway() external view returns (contract IAxelarGateway)

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).code: function increaseAllowance(address spender, uint256 addedValue) external nonpayable returns (bool)
increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

amount.description: The amount of UMEE tokens to be swapped.

swap(uint256).details: Swaps Deprecated Gravity Bridge UMEE for the new, axelar supported UMEE tokens.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).code: function transfer(address to, uint256 amount) external nonpayable returns (bool)
transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).code: function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 amount) external nonpayable returns (bool)
transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

Approval.code: event Approval(address indexed owner, address indexed spender, uint256 value)

Swap.code: event Swap(address indexed user, uint256 amount)

user.description: The address of the user who initiated the swap.

Swap.details: Emitted when a token swap occurs.

Transfer.code: event Transfer(address indexed from, address indexed to, uint256 value)

InvalidAmount.details: Custom error thrown when the provided amount is less then zero.
